page.title: 10The church in Ashby
page.content: Built in c 1100,mentioned in Domesday the Church of St.Leodegarius is at the east end of the village. Over the years it has been added to,as shown by the different types of windows,fragments of 15th century glass still being preserved. Rich in history the church boasts-murals,brasses and a rare three decker pulpit.In the south west corner,a musicians gallery reminds us of the days before organs. The very old font,is made from a solid cylinder of stone,exact age unknown,but the wooden lid is 15th century. St.Ledger is a contraction of St.Leodegarius.
